content.description: Song sparrows are found in a variety of habitats, including marshes, grasslands, agricultural fields, and suburban areas. They feed on a variety of organisms, including beetles, caterpillars, snails, and earthworms. They also consume plants, including different types of grains and berries. The table below summarizes the reproductive data for song sparrows.
content.question: REPRODUCTIVE DATA FOR SONG SPARROWS Clutch Size 1-6 eggs Number of Broods per year 1-7 broods Incubation Period 12-15 days Nestling Period 9-12 days Based on the description and the data table above, which of the following combinations best classifies the song sparrow?

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Describe patterns or trends in data.
